page.title: 08The Wem Brewery 2
page.content: The water used to come from a well on the site but this is only used in an emergency. At present the beer is all real ale and only in the 200 tied pubs but a new venture will be to brew and sell a new keg beer to sell in the free trade. The old chimney has been knocked down to give space for new keg beer equipment. Over 60.000 barrels are brewed per year and each barrell. holds 36 gallons. There are the three kinds of draught beers brewed at Wem. XXX is the cheapest. It is a dark mild. Pale ale is a bit more expensive and a bit stronger. Wem Best Bitter is the dearest, strongest,and most popular. All of the pubs are within a radius of 60 miles.The main trading areas are north into Staffordshire, east into Wolvehamton, south into Herefordshire and west to Newtown. The most beer is sold in the Telford area.
